newsitem.title: JAPAN: Square sees 97/98 sales of 8.7 mln software units.
newsitem.headline: Square sees 97/98 sales of 8.7 mln software units.

text.p: Square Co Ltd said on Friday that it projected sales of 8.7 million units of game software in the next financial year beginning April 1997.

A company executive told a news conference the firm had completed a three-year business plan in which it forecasts a parent current profit of 15 bln yen and a group current profit of 20 billion yen in the year to March 2000.
He said that in the year from April the company"s parent current profit was projected to total 11 billion yen and a group net profit forecast of 7.9 billion yen.
Earlier, the game software maker announced it had revised down its parent current profit forecast for 1996/97 to 1.5 billion yen from its initial prediction of 9.1 billion yen.
Square also forecast a 1996/97 group net loss of 2.9 billion yen, down from its earlier forecast of a 5.3 billion yen profit.
The company said in a statement that the downward revision was a result of having to postpone the launch of four out of 11 software titles that were to have been released in the year to March 1997.

The company said it postponed the launch of the titles because it wanted to improve their quality to the same level as its mainstay "Final Fantasy VII", which was recently released for Sony Corp"s 32-bit PlayStation game console.
